title: New 'Pokemon' Anime Movies Blu-ray Scheduled
body:
New ‘Pokemon’ Anime Movies Blu-ray Scheduled

After previously bringing out a Pokemon movie collection for the first three films in steelbook form back in 2016, Viz Media through Warner Bros. Distribution are set to bring it out again in a lower price regular form. The new set is scheduled for an October 2nd, 2018 debut priced at $24.98 for …

Check out the full article by Chris Beveridge on The Fandom Post!

summary:
Flat color version :3

 Riolu!Dallie’s fur is lighter and fluffier because her father is a Furfrou.

 Or if one looks at her...
caption:
Flat color version :3

Riolu!Dallie’s fur is lighter and fluffier because her father is a Furfrou.

Or if one looks at her from a classic Mystery Dungeon storyline, she’s somehow got Furfrou genetics and didn’t bother asking questions. She’s fluffy and she’s gonna enjoy it XD

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1350: Pokemon Collector (HeartGold & SoulSilver)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1350: Pokemon Collector (HeartGold & SoulSilver)
body: Apparently, the HeartGold and SoulSilver set was capable of having its own original Supporters. This one was simple but did something very important. When used, you got to search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokemon and put them into your hand. This was helpful for almost any deck out there. The only ones that would be likely to pass on this without a second thought were the occasional HGSS-On deck that ran a ridiculously low number of powerful Basic Pokemon and nothing else. Any deck that was reaching Basic Pokemon numbers even in the high single digits, let alone the many that had more, was probably going to use this card. Pokemon Collector was just that good.

The only ones that would be likely to pass on this without a second thought were the occasional HGSS-On deck that ran a ridiculously low number of powerful Basic Pokemon and nothing else. Any deck that was reaching Basic Pokemon numbers even in the high single digits, let alone the many that had more, was probably going to use this card. Pokemon Collector was just that good.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Oh what is that?! It’s disgusting.  Smoochdra Goodra and Smoochum fusion Dragon/Psychic Type Ability: Gooey The Unholy Pokemon...
caption:
Oh what is that?! It’s disgusting. 

Smoochdra

Goodra and Smoochum fusion

Dragon/Psychic Type

Ability: Gooey

The Unholy Pokemon

Born from the swamps of Hell, this little abomination seeks for the souls of the innocent to destroy them.  Its kisses are very salivary.  Why was this thing created?

Fusion for @houndoom-kaboom. I hope you like this abomination.  My favourite with my least favourite.  Goodra didn’t deserve this.  This is officially the worst thing I have ever created. I hope you’re happy.

summary: *My apologies, new anon! I actually forgot to answer part of your question! As for Alolan Pokemon, I think the redesigns are...
caption:
*My apologies, new anon! I actually forgot to answer part of your question! As for Alolan Pokemon, I think the redesigns are very creative. Some, like the Exeggutor (a tall and slender type of palm tree) and the Vulpix (a cloud puppy) are really great. Some, like the Dugtrio with the surfer hair and the actual surfing Raichu are silly and cute.

*Some are just… Well… please help them. The Alolan Rattata looks like Mario’s fursona, and when he evolves he just… inflates? and looks painfully swollen. It’s a-him, Rattata! The Alolan Graveler has… arm hair and a unibrow. He looks like he’ll fix your car while drinking a six pack of beer.

*My very very favorite though is the Alolan Meowth. Alolan Meowth is so fabulous and aloof. Purr-fect if you will.

title: Donphan - 232
body:
It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

- Pokemon Gold, Stadium 2, Leaf Green, HeartGold, X

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Forces of Nature
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Forces of Nature
body:
641: Tornadus

Here we are, at yet another set of Pokemon that have collected a lot of fandom ire. This time though, I… don’t have many words to defend them on. I thought nothing of them when they were first leaked, and think even less of them the more I really got into them.

But Tornadus at least has a distinction in the fact that it’s the only pure Flying type in the game, currently. Which is fitting for a thing in control of heavy wind storms. Sadly, though, this apparently makes it far more inferior compared to its two companions since it doesn’t have as much move diversity, and everything else about it is pretty unimpressive. And it’s a problem all three of them have, in that they’re all palette swaps of each other with slightly different hairdos. The only major distinction they have from one another are their tails. And while the tails are some neat imagery with how they’re wrapped around their body, Tornadus’s tail just looks haphazardly designed. “Oh, a wind elemental? Better lazily put swirls on top of swirls.”

And also they’re muscly men. That’s not a huge negative against them since here it feels a bit more fitting as deity figures than just. Things that are awkwardly human-looking are running around like wild animals. But still. There’s plenty of design elements angles that feel like they got to waste here.

Personal Score: 4/10

Not a winner, nah.

Therian Form:

Come Black and White 2 though, and the genies received alternate “Therian” forms, which are all the genies but as more animal-like beings. Which almost feels like an apology for how the three were the same sprite but with some different spots on top in the first Black and White. These forms are basically why I’m gonna opt to skip out on redraws this time. I think my redesign attempt at Machamp kinda proved I shouldn’t be touching these folks, but at the very least these Therian forms kinda redesign the three to be at least passable for me. Which seems like a fair way to approach that. I don’t care enough to “fix” the genies, but these Therian forms kinda bump these up to at least be passable anyway.

Anyway, rather predictably, Therian Tornadus becomes a giant bird. But I can’t help but kinda like how stupid of a bird it looks. It looks relatively average silhouette-wise, but then you see the garish green and purple with that absurd looking tail, combined with that awkward man-face it keeps even as a bird. It really makes it look more like a mythical deity, and I kinda wish that was a design feature that carried over to the other Therian beasts.

Personal Score: 7/10

Look at this gaudy mess. I love it.

642: Thundurus

And like I said, these Pokemon are just palette swaps of each other. Blue Tornadus here is an Electric/Flying type, donning a more spiky and striking tail. I’m sure they’re mean to call raijin to mind as well.

Personal Score: 4/10

Second verse, same as the first.

Therian Form:

…Look, I said these Therian forms bump them up to be at least passable, haha.

And then Blue Tornadus becomes…this? I’ll admit, I’ve no solid clue what this is meant to be. But my best guess is a Dragon. But otherwise, this thing looks absolutely ridiculous. Just looks at it. That cartoony muzzle. The yaoihands with the skipping of leg day. Topped off with a righteous mustache and hairdo. What an idiot.

Personal Score: 6/10

All joking aside, it’s a coolish creature. If… really silly looking the more longer you stare at it.

645: Landurus

Yes, I know this is technically going out of Pokedex order. But dammit. My OCD is more angry about them being separated than it is about skipping two Pokemon for now. I don’t even know WHY they decided to do it that way. Especially with regional dexes being a thing, cause it’s most likely because Landurus is only accessed via postgame while most of the other Legendaries are available before the end of the game. But still. Augh!

Anyway, Red Luigi here is interestingly, Ground/Flying type. Apparently meant to control earth and is a god of making soil very farmable. And yet it’s the leader over a creator of tornadoes and lightning storms. Okay then.

Personal Score: 4/10

Aw jeez who woulda saw a 4/10 coming?

Therian Form:

And out of the Therian forms, Red Luigi’s is easily the least interesting of the three. It’s just some four-legged monster thing. A tiger I suppose. I know you already had Terrakion and Bouffalant but. Why not a bull or buffalo? I’d say those represent land better than a tiger does. Eh.

Maybe, just maybe, they had the inkling of an idea fo Tapu Bulu even all the way back then and wanted to save that idea for a better Pokemon

Personal Score: 5/10

The only slightest of upgrades.

Overall:

Yeah, a miss all around here, I’m afraid. The Therian forms are notably nicer, but none of them hit it off much better. Just more drops into a bucket that already had too many damn Legendaries in it.

[Archive]

[[MORE]]

I think my redesign attempt at Machamp kinda proved I shouldn’t be touching these folks, but at the very least these Therian forms kinda redesign the three to be at least passable for me. Which seems like a fair way to approach that. I don’t care enough to “fix” the genies, but these Therian forms kinda bump these up to at least be passable anyway.

Anyway, rather predictably, Therian Tornadus becomes a giant bird. But I can’t help but kinda like how stupid of a bird it looks. It looks relatively average silhouette-wise, but then you see the garish green and purple with that absurd looking tail, combined with that awkward man-face it keeps even as a bird. It really makes it look more like a mythical deity, and I kinda wish that was a design feature that carried over to the other Therian beasts.

Personal Score: 7/10

Look at this gaudy mess. I love it.

642: Thundurus

And like I said, these Pokemon are just palette swaps of each other. Blue Tornadus here is an Electric/Flying type, donning a more spiky and striking tail. I’m sure they’re mean to call raijin to mind as well.

Personal Score: 4/10

Second verse, same as the first.

Therian Form:

…Look, I said these Therian forms bump them up to be at least passable, haha.

And then Blue Tornadus becomes…this? I’ll admit, I’ve no solid clue what this is meant to be. But my best guess is a Dragon. But otherwise, this thing looks absolutely ridiculous. Just looks at it. That cartoony muzzle. The yaoihands with the skipping of leg day. Topped off with a righteous mustache and hairdo. What an idiot.

Personal Score: 6/10

All joking aside, it’s a coolish creature. If… really silly looking the more longer you stare at it.

645: Landurus

Yes, I know this is technically going out of Pokedex order. But dammit. My OCD is more angry about them being separated than it is about skipping two Pokemon for now. I don’t even know WHY they decided to do it that way. Especially with regional dexes being a thing, cause it’s most likely because Landurus is only accessed via postgame while most of the other Legendaries are available before the end of the game. But still. Augh!

Anyway, Red Luigi here is interestingly, Ground/Flying type. Apparently meant to control earth and is a god of making soil very farmable. And yet it’s the leader over a creator of tornadoes and lightning storms. Okay then.

Personal Score: 4/10

Aw jeez who woulda saw a 4/10 coming?

Therian Form:

And out of the Therian forms, Red Luigi’s is easily the least interesting of the three. It’s just some four-legged monster thing. A tiger I suppose. I know you already had Terrakion and Bouffalant but. Why not a bull or buffalo? I’d say those represent land better than a tiger does. Eh.

Maybe, just maybe, they had the inkling of an idea fo Tapu Bulu even all the way back then and wanted to save that idea for a better Pokemon

Personal Score: 5/10

The only slightest of upgrades.

Overall:

Yeah, a miss all around here, I’m afraid. The Therian forms are notably nicer, but none of them hit it off much better. Just more drops into a bucket that already had too many damn Legendaries in it.

[Archive]
trail.content:
641: Tornadus

Here we are, at yet another set of Pokemon that have collected a lot of fandom ire. This time though, I… don’t have many words to defend them on. I thought nothing of them when they were first leaked, and think even less of them the more I really got into them.

But Tornadus at least has a distinction in the fact that it’s the only pure Flying type in the game, currently. Which is fitting for a thing in control of heavy wind storms. Sadly, though, this apparently makes it far more inferior compared to its two companions since it doesn’t have as much move diversity, and everything else about it is pretty unimpressive. And it’s a problem all three of them have, in that they’re all palette swaps of each other with slightly different hairdos. The only major distinction they have from one another are their tails. And while the tails are some neat imagery with how they’re wrapped around their body, Tornadus’s tail just looks haphazardly designed. “Oh, a wind elemental? Better lazily put swirls on top of swirls.”

And also they’re muscly men. That’s not a huge negative against them since here it feels a bit more fitting as deity figures than just. Things that are awkwardly human-looking are running around like wild animals. But still. There’s plenty of design elements angles that feel like they got to waste here.

Personal Score: 4/10

Not a winner, nah.

Therian Form:

Come Black and White 2 though, and the genies received alternate “Therian” forms, which are all the genies but as more animal-like beings. Which almost feels like an apology for how the three were the same sprite but with some different spots on top in the first Black and White. These forms are basically why I’m gonna opt to skip out on redraws this time. I think my redesign attempt at Machamp kinda proved I shouldn’t be touching these folks, but at the very least these Therian forms kinda redesign the three to be at least passable for me. Which seems like a fair way to approach that. I don’t care enough to “fix” the genies, but these Therian forms kinda bump these up to at least be passable anyway.

Anyway, rather predictably, Therian Tornadus becomes a giant bird. But I can’t help but kinda like how stupid of a bird it looks. It looks relatively average silhouette-wise, but then you see the garish green and purple with that absurd looking tail, combined with that awkward man-face it keeps even as a bird. It really makes it look more like a mythical deity, and I kinda wish that was a design feature that carried over to the other Therian beasts.

Personal Score: 7/10

Look at this gaudy mess. I love it.

642: Thundurus

And like I said, these Pokemon are just palette swaps of each other. Blue Tornadus here is an Electric/Flying type, donning a more spiky and striking tail. I’m sure they’re mean to call raijin to mind as well.

Personal Score: 4/10

Second verse, same as the first.

Therian Form:

…Look, I said these Therian forms bump them up to be at least passable, haha.

And then Blue Tornadus becomes…this? I’ll admit, I’ve no solid clue what this is meant to be. But my best guess is a Dragon. But otherwise, this thing looks absolutely ridiculous. Just looks at it. That cartoony muzzle. The yaoihands with the skipping of leg day. Topped off with a righteous mustache and hairdo. What an idiot.

Personal Score: 6/10

All joking aside, it’s a coolish creature. If… really silly looking the more longer you stare at it.

645: Landurus

Yes, I know this is technically going out of Pokedex order. But dammit. My OCD is more angry about them being separated than it is about skipping two Pokemon for now. I don’t even know WHY they decided to do it that way. Especially with regional dexes being a thing, cause it’s most likely because Landurus is only accessed via postgame while most of the other Legendaries are available before the end of the game. But still. Augh!

Anyway, Red Luigi here is interestingly, Ground/Flying type. Apparently meant to control earth and is a god of making soil very farmable. And yet it’s the leader over a creator of tornadoes and lightning storms. Okay then.

Personal Score: 4/10

Aw jeez who woulda saw a 4/10 coming?

Therian Form:

And out of the Therian forms, Red Luigi’s is easily the least interesting of the three. It’s just some four-legged monster thing. A tiger I suppose. I know you already had Terrakion and Bouffalant but. Why not a bull or buffalo? I’d say those represent land better than a tiger does. Eh.

Maybe, just maybe, they had the inkling of an idea fo Tapu Bulu even all the way back then and wanted to save that idea for a better Pokemon

Personal Score: 5/10

The only slightest of upgrades.

Overall:

Yeah, a miss all around here, I’m afraid. The Therian forms are notably nicer, but none of them hit it off much better. Just more drops into a bucket that already had too many damn Legendaries in it.

[Archive]

caption:
『 𝙷𝙾𝙼𝙴 』     ☆       『 𝚁𝚄𝙻𝙴𝚂 』
                                 『 𝙼𝙴𝚂𝚂𝙰𝙶𝙴 』   ☆   『 𝙼𝙰𝚂𝚃𝙴𝚁𝙻𝙸𝚂𝚃 』

Looking for a place where you can write your muses to your hearts’ content? Ever wonder if your OC will find a place to fit in? Then look no further!

                                  Welcome to the National Park !

We are a game-verse Pokémon RP group full of fun, friendly, and active members.  Our goal is to provide a comfortable atmosphere where members can write and develop their muses at their own pace, without all the stress of running an indie blog.

In addition to our community of wonderful writers, we offer frequent events, interactive Discord server, unlimited meme opportunities, and a special ‘Member of the Month’ spotlight!

We love welcoming new friends, so why not check us out today?

summary: omg your recent post got me thinking!!! which of the elite four songs do you think suits ouma the most?
question: omg your recent post got me thinking!!! which of the elite four songs do you think suits ouma the most?
answer:
Maybe the Sinnoh Elite Four/Gym theme Black 2/White 2 version!
there’s so much going on and with so many underlying things and I think that suits him very well. 

the Kalos elite four theme is so good tho but I don’t think it fits him.

the Kalos elite four theme is so good tho but I don’t think it fits him.
